definition: to be indifferent/not to matter/cannot be said to be
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
surname Wei
to speak/to say/to name/to designate/meaning/sense

sentences.english: Conformity is not in itself a good or a bad thing.
sentences.chinese: 从众本身无所谓是好是坏。

sentences.english: Unless you're paralyzed to the extent that you can't even open your mouth, fear is irrelevant.
sentences.chinese: 除非你被吓得连嘴都张不开，不然害怕是无所谓的。

sentences.english: It doesn’t matter if it takes you a year or a week to read a book.
sentences.chinese: 无论你花一年或者一周去读一本书，这都无所谓。

sentences.english: There was a real biting indifference in her behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 她的行为带有一种刺人的无所谓。

sentences.english: As long as the quality is good,I do not care about the price.
sentences.chinese: 只要能保证质量，我对价钱无所谓。

sentences.english: The old soldier was so inured to danger that he became careless.
sentences.chinese: 那位老战士已习惯了危险因而变得无所谓。

sentences.english: Looked that resembles the indifferent extraordinariness, actually also has the right which obtains.
sentences.chinese: 看似无所谓的平凡者，却也有得到的权利。

sentences.english: Pehaps the answer itself is meaningless.
sentences.chinese: 或许答案本身是无所谓的。

sentences.english: I am now so thick-skinned that such incidents hardly fuss me at all.
sentences.chinese: 我现在的脸皮厚得很，这样的情形对我已经无所谓了。

sentences.english: Just as well. I hear it isn't good.
sentences.chinese: 无所谓，我听说那出戏不太好看。

sentences.english: Whether it takes you one year or one week to read a book, it is not important.
sentences.chinese: 无论你花一年或者一周去读一本书，这都无所谓。
你们可能对一夫多妻制无所谓。

sentences.english: We relished wearing the same grass-stained, smelly pants for as long as possible.
sentences.chinese: 就算一直穿着草迹斑斑臭不啦叽的裤子也无所谓。

sentences.english: Igawa rebounds, and girls can step out door have been a success.
sentences.chinese: 宅男，剩女们觉得无所谓，能踏出家门就已经成功了。

sentences.english: Those that think it permissible to tell white lies soon grow color blind.
sentences.chinese: 认为说白谎无所谓的人很快就会变成色盲。

sentences.english: They are not afraid to mimic, even if they get it wrong.
sentences.chinese: 他们不怕有样学样，就算犯错也无所谓。

definition: to pay no attention to/not to mind
not to care
it doesn't matter
not in the least concerned (idiom)/reckless/couldn't give a damn about it/unperturbed/couldn't care less/harum scarum
anyway/in any case/to come over from the enemy's side
to care about/equivalent of 在於|在于[zai4 yu2]
at worst/if worst comes to worst/serious/alarming
not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
to care about/to mind
not to mind/unconcerned
(reduplicated) whether... or.../never mind/fine (indicating acceptance or resignation)
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
nothing/it doesn't matter/it's nothing/never mind
see 沒關係|没关系[mei2 guan1 xi5]
granted that/even if
